author: joeyaiello
body:
## Expected behavior

``` powershell
'test' | Write-Information -InformationAction Continue
test
```
## Actual behavior

``` powershell
'test' | Write-Information  -InformationAction Continue

cmdlet Write-Information at command pipeline position 1
Supply values for the following parameters:
MessageData: 'test'
'test'
Write-Information : The input object cannot be bound to any parameters for the command either because the command does not take pipeline input or the input and its properties do not match any of the parameters that take pipeline input.
At line:1 char:10
+ 'test' | Write-Information  -InformationAction Continue
+          ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidArgument: (test:String) [Write-Information], ParameterBindingExcepti
   on
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : InputObjectNotBound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.WriteInformationCommand
```
## Environment data

All versions of PowerShell 5+

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @joeyaiello [MessageData's type is `Object`. ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility/commands/utility/write.cs#L182)It would be better to replace 'strings' on `objects` in the issue's subject.

title: Write-Information should accept strings from the pipeline
